STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 28, 2020
Jasmine Calhoun
Saginaw Co Youth Prot Council
Po Box 3191
Saginaw, MI 48605
RE: License #: CI730201193
Innerlink
1110 Howard
Saginaw, MI 48601
Dear Ms. Calhoun:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
April 13-20, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Venus M.Decker, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(248) 639-9585
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
(g) If the employee has criminal convictions, the
institution shall complete a written evaluation of the
convictions that addresses the nature of the conviction, the
length of time since the conviction, and the relationship of
the conviction to regulated activity for the purpose of
determining suitability for employment in the institution.
Nine new employee records were reviewed. One out of nine
records did not have an assessment from the institution
outlining the above details.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance
within 30 days of the completion of the probationary period
or within 180 days, whichever is less, and a written
evaluation of the employee’s performance annually
thereafter.
Twelve employee records were reviewed. One out of twelve did
not have a performance evaluation completed within 180 days.
The evaluation was due on 1/2020 and it was completed in
2/2020.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
4

R 400.4113 (b) (c) (g) (h)
(b ): All employees including interns and volunteers need to have true verification of
education from either an accredited college or university
(c): Verification of high school diploma is needed when specified by the rule
(g) and (h): employees must complete a statement concerning criminal convictions. If
a future employee divulges a criminal history, but this does not show up on the
clearances, the employee and agency are still to complete an assessment. Once
criminal history is known, it must be evaluated.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has not submitted a corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
4/24/20
